text: The 1907 Washington State football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1907 college football season. The team competed as an independent under head coach John R. Bender, compiling a record of 7–1. ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Opponent ! scope="col" | Location ! scope="col" | Score ! scope="col" | Attendance |- ! scope="row" | October 5 | Eastern Washington | Home | 46-0 W | NA |- ! scope="row" | October 12 | Blair Business College | Home | 86-0 W | NA |- ! scope="row" | October 18 | Montana | Home | 38-0 W | NA |- ! scope="row" | October 26 | Spokane AC | Home | 70-0 W | NA |- ! scope="row" | November 8 | Idaho | Away | 4-5 L | 2,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 21 | Washington | Away | 11-5 W | 3,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 28 | Whitman | Away | 16-8 W | 2,000 |- ! scope="row" | December 25 | St. Louis | Salem | 11-0 W | NA |} ==References== Washington State Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Category:1907 in Washington (state)
